intro: Hieracium floccibifidum, commonly known as the fluffier hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and yellow composite flowers that resemble daisies. Native to Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant has a rosette growth form, with basal leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. It is considered a weed in some regions due to its rapid spread and ability to colonize various environments.
